description:
Spacious SIX BEDROOM Detached House Located on the Desirable Leftley Estate.
This Property is Well Presented and Features THREE RECEPTION ROOMS, a Kitchen-Diner, Ground Floor Bathroom, WC and Lean To.
The First Floor has FOUR DOUBLE BEDROOMS, each with its own En Suite, and a further TWO DOUBLE BEDROOMS with En Suites can be found in the Loft.
The Property Boasts a Driveway for Multiple Cars, as well as a Large Garage.

Stratton Drive, IG11 9HH – Exceptional 3-Bedroom semi-detached Family Home on a Corner Plot with Huge Potential

Perfectly positioned on the ever-popular Leftley Estate, this impressive three-bedroom home sits proudly on a substantial corner plot, offering a wealth of space inside and out – and the exciting potential for a double-storey side extension (STPP).

Upon entering, you are greeted by two spacious reception rooms, ideal for entertaining guests or enjoying quiet evenings with family. The layout is both practical and inviting, allowing for a seamless flow between the living areas.

The kitchen area offers plenty of room for everyday cooking and entertaining, while a handy ground floor WC is tucked neatly under the stairs for convenience.

On the first floor you have three well-proportioned bedrooms provide ample space for relaxation, ensuring that everyone has their own sanctuary, and a large family bathroom complete with bath, separate shower, WC, and wash basin – perfect for busy mornings.

One of the standout features of this home is the parking space available for two vehicles, a rare find in urban settings. This convenience adds to the overall appeal, making daily life just a little easier.

The location on Stratton Drive is particularly advantageous, with local amenities, schools, and parks within easy reach. This makes it an excellent choice for families looking to settle in a friendly community.

In summary, this semi-detached house offers a fantastic opportunity to own a piece of Barking's history while enjoying the comforts of modern living. With its spacious rooms, convenient parking, and prime location, it is a property not to be missed..

Up to 4 weeks rent free on select units on a 12-month contract when you move in by 31/12!

Alameda has been designed as a haven of contemporary calm amidst the energy of London’s most exciting new neighbourhood. Step inside and you’ll find interiors dressed in soft, soothing tones that instantly feel like home. Private balconies open out to the buzz of Wembley Park below — the perfect balance of tranquillity and connection. If you dream of peace without missing a moment of the action, Alameda is where you’ll find it.

Choose from six carefully considered colour palettes, each offering its own personality and style. Every apartment is complemented by a bespoke furniture collection so your home is as stylish as it is welcoming.

Exclusive resident perks include:

- Bespoke furniture packages
- Premium Samsung integrated appliances
- Utilities set up and ready to go
- A spectacular roof garden with a 6m outdoor cinema screen for gaming nights or film marathons under the stars.
- 24/7 support & security
- Two beautifully designed resident lounges
- A spacious work-from-home hub
- Secure bike storage
- Pet-friendly living

Living at Alameda means you’re never far from something delicious or exciting. On your doorstep you’ll find a tempting mix of restaurants and hangouts — from the vibrant flavours of Masalchi to a cosy evening at the White Horse Pub. Treat yourself to a classic bite at Five Guys, indulge in decadent desserts at Haute Dolci, or unwind with friends over cocktails and tapas at Estadio Lounge. With so much choice just downstairs, your new favourite spot could be right under your home.

*Please note: Alameda offers a range of apartment layouts and outlooks. Photos and floor plans are for illustrative purposes only. Enquire today to arrange a private tour of our available homes.

*Available to students

Portland Place is a luxurious Georgian townhouse, recently transformed into a stunning family home with timeless interiors and nods to its rich history. The recent refurbishment of this exquisite property was orchestrated by renowned interior designer Hubert Zandberg, in collaboration with architectural designer Jan Swanpoel.
While the exterior facade remains unchanged, the interior has been reimagined into extraordinary spaces for entertaining and relaxation, while retaining original features and exceptional ceiling heights. The home boasts an essence of 1940s aesthetic with nods to a variety of bold styles, creating a unique and stylish living space. Portland Place is equipped with the latest in modern technologies, including a beautiful Wolf Range Cooker, a Lutron Homeworks lighting and shading control system, and integrated control features.
The principal suite, which was once the building's Grand Salon, is a tranquil retreat from the city with two ensuite dressing rooms and two finely finished bathrooms. Additionally, there are three full guest bedrooms with ensuite bathrooms and staff accommodation on the top floor of the home.
Portland Place is located in the heart of Prime Central London, with Oxford Circus at one end and The Regent’s Park at the other. This postcode exudes prestige and elegance, surrounded by some of London's top restaurants, boutiques, and health & wellbeing amenities. This area offers a retreat from the hustle and bustle of London's busy streets, with one of London's finest Royal Parks just a 5-minute walk away. Alternatively, you have London’s epicentre, Regent’s Street and Oxford Street, a 5-minute walk in the opposite direction. Experience the luxurious lifestyle of Portland Place and make it your own.

Having been owned by the same family for decades, this is a rare chance to buy a freehold house within this prestigious part of W1T. This characterful property offers elegant entertainment space spread over the ground and first floors, including a well proportioned ground floor reception room and dining room, a stunning first floor reception room with full length balcony and a kitchen/breakfast room. There is flexible space above, with four bedrooms (two ensuite), a family bathroom and an additional kitchen/utility room, with loft and eave storage on the easily accessible top floor.

The house further benefits from a peaceful rear terrace facing down the mews, utility rooms and guest WC.

This beautiful home, with many intact period features, occupies four floors (plus loft and eaves) of a Georgian terrace.

Situation

The property forms a central part of a handsome, listed Georgian terrace, constructed c. 1793. Conway Street is quietly situated within the Fitzroy Square Conservation Area, and just a few yards north of Fitzroy Square itself. The area retains its Georgian charm and the influence of Robert Adam, some of whose finest neoclassical work is seen nearby.

Fitzrovia boasts a thriving community with grand buildings, galleries, restaurants and cafes. Nearby there are wide open spaces of Regent's Park including various sporting amenities. The property has enviable transport links including Great Portland Street / Euston Square Stations (Hammersmith & City, Circle and Metropolitan lines), Warren Street (Northern, Victoria lines), Regent's Park (Bakerloo), Goodge Street (Northern line) and Tottenham Court Road (Northern, Central & Elizabeth lines).

An exceptional four-bedroom, four-bathroom duplex penthouse occupying the 53rd floor of the landmark South Quay Plaza development by Berkeley. Spanning 2,731 sq ft, with a spectacular wraparound terrace, this residence offers some of the most breathtaking views across Canary Wharf, the River Thames and beyond.

 Interior

 The lower level showcases striking herringbone parquet flooring, soaring double-height ceilings, and floor-to-ceiling dual-aspect glazing. The open-plan reception flows seamlessly into a bespoke designer kitchen with Gaggenau appliances and a statement marble island. A generously sized bedroom suite is also located on this level, complete with luxury en-suite bathroom.

 Upstairs, three further bedroom suites are arranged for comfort and privacy, each benefiting from its own stylish en-suite. The principal suite enjoys direct access to the terrace, abundant storage, and panoramic skyline views.

 Development & Amenities

 Residents of South Quay Plaza enjoy exclusive access to the Quay Club, featuring:

 20m swimming pool overlooking South Dock

 Spa, sauna, steam room & wellness suite

 State-of-the-art gym and fitness studios

 Private cinema, dining rooms, games and karaoke lounge

 Co-working spaces and meeting rooms (Level 37 iGarden)

 56th-floor Quay Club bar and lounge with panoramic terrace

 24-hour concierge and estate security

 Key Information

 Size: 2,731 sq ft

 Bedrooms/Bathrooms: 4 Bed | 4 Bath (all en-suite) | Duplex Penthouse

 Floor: 53rd with wraparound terrace

 Lease: 999 years

 Service Charge: £9.53 per sq ft per annum (subject to change)

 Council Tax Band: G

 Price: £5,460,000

 Location

 Located moments from South Quay DLR and a short walk from Canary Wharf station (Jubilee Line & Elizabeth Line), South Quay Plaza places the City, West End and Heathrow within easy reach.

Windrush is a beautifully maintained widebeam barge that offered an opportunity to enjoy life on the water without compromising on comfort or location. With its elegant lines and thoughtfully designed interior, this vessel combined traditional charm with modern amenities, making it an ideal London pied-à-terre.

 The barge featured an open-plan living area filled with natural light, a well-appointed galley kitchen with modern appliances, and three comfortable cabins. The master bedroom included built-in storage and a private en suite. The main bathroom was designed as a contemporary wetroom, complemented by a separate toilet, adding both style and practicality to the living space. The vessel was also equipped with efficient heating and insulation, ensuring year-round comfort.

 Windrush was moored in a prime location within St Katharine Docks, one of London’s most prestigious marinas. This central setting offered excellent transport links, with Tower Hill Underground and Tower Gateway DLR stations just a short walk away. The marina itself is a vibrant community, home to a variety of restaurants, cafés, and bars, providing residents and visitors with a rich selection of dining and leisure options.

 Windrush represented a unique lifestyle opportunity in one of London’s most iconic waterside locations. Mooring charges £25,548 per annum approx.
